metadata.name: GROTTO
metadata.description:
"
How deep is your universe? 
I completely fell down into the grotto I made. 
Even I didn't know the depth of it. 
"

Do you remember? The first scars. The first moments of despair. 

It wasn't until I faced the darkness that I began to understand myself as a human being.

It's still scary and unsettling, but with this work, I felt a sense of release and liberation, like, "Oh, I've finally found it. My own healing.'

The work may come across as a bit dark and dank, and that's the intention, but what can I say, I'm not a very pleasant human being.

It's actually quite embarrassing to show your inner world.

It's like being naked and feeling the full weight of the world's eyes on you.

It took me a long time to grit my teeth and get started.

Once you're constantly depicting your own dark world, you're able to let go of the things you're stuck with, right?
